infotexts.missionsuccess.cargonitroglycerin: The chemicals have been successfully delivered.
infotexts.missiondescription.cargoclowngear: A local clown syndicate is offering [reward] credits for delivering a shipment of clowning supplies to [location2].
infotexts.missionsuccess.cargoclowngear: The clown gear has been successfully delivered.
infotexts.missiondescription.cargoconstructionmine: A consignment of materials for construction needs to be transported to [location2] and the crew chief here is prepared to pay [reward] credits for your trouble.
infotexts.missionsuccess.cargoconstructionminerals: The materials have been successfully delivered.
infotexts.missiondescription.cargosecurityminerals: The security team at [location2] needs to be resupplied with materials for weapon fabrication. There's [reward] credits for you if you get these supplies to them.
infotexts.missionsuccess.cargosecurityminerals: The materials have been successfully delivered.
infotexts.missiondescription.cargomeditems: A consignment of medical items needs to be transported to [location2]. There's [reward] credits if you can get them there.
infotexts.missionsuccess.cargomeditems: The materials have been successfully delivered.
infotexts.missiondescription.personneltransport: We have a crew member here who needs to get to [location2] in a hurry. The payment is [reward] credits if you get them there in once piece.
infotexts.missionsuccess.personneltransport: The personnel have been successfully delivered.
infotexts.missiondescription.prospect: The mining crews want to start extracting [resourcename] if you can prove there are enough deposits of it in the area between [location1] and the mining outpost at [location2]. If you can find [quantity] units, you'll be paid a reward of [reward] credits, and you can keep whatever you find.
infotexts.missionsuccess.prospect: Resource has been prospected successfully. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward.
infotexts.missiondescription.cargomedemergency: A crew member over at [location2] has gone and gotten themselves a nasty case of morbusine poisoning. They might stand a chance of survival if you can get a shipment of antidote to them ASAP... You'll be paid [reward] credits on delivery.
infotexts.missionsuccess.cargomedemergency: The antidote has been successfully delivered.
infotexts.missiondescription.beacon: Head over to [location2] and drop a beacon to begin the process of colonizing the area. Payment is [reward] credits when the beacon starts transmitting
infotexts.missiondescriptionneutral.pvpmission: A Coalition vessel has been dispatched from [location1] to destroy a renegade vessel at the outskirts of [location2].
infotexts.missiondescription1.pvpmission: A renegade vessel has been detected at the outskirts of [location2]. Treason against the Europa Coalition is punishable by death—eliminate the renegades by any means necessary.
infotexts.missiondescription2.pvpmission: You're a member of a renegade group opposing the Europa Coalition. According to your informants at [location1], a Coalition vessel has just been dispatched on a mission to take down your boat. Eliminate their crew by any means necessary.
infotexts.entitydescription.door: A sliding door with no integrated buttons—has to be wired manually.
infotexts.entitydescription.windoweddoor: A sliding door with a window. No integrated buttons—has to be wired manually.
infotexts.entitydescription.hatch: A door, but on the horizontal axis. No integrated buttons—has to be wired manually.
infotexts.entitydescription.doorwbuttons: A sliding door with two integrated buttons.
infotexts.entitydescription.windoweddoorwbuttons: A sliding door with a window and two integrated buttons.
infotexts.entitydescription.hatchwbuttons: A door, but on the horizontal axis. Two integrated buttons.
infotexts.entitydescription.navterminal: Usable device for setting the course of the sub.
infotexts.entitydescription.shuttlenavterminal: Usable device for setting the course of the shuttle.
infotexts.entitydescription.sonarmonitor: Usable device for observing the sub's sonar. Non-interactive.
infotexts.entitydescription.statusmonitor: Usable device for viewing a schematic of the sub as well as the status of each room.
infotexts.entitydescription.sonartransducer: Sonar generator, allowing the sonar monitors and navigation terminals to receive a sonar signal other than the default one (useful for drones and remote-controlled shuttles).
infotexts.entitydescription.engine: Usable device for generating motion on the X axis.
infotexts.entitydescription.largeengine: Usable device for generating motion on the X axis.
infotexts.entitydescription.shuttleengine: Usable device for generating motion on the X axis.
infotexts.entitydescription.fabricator: A machine capable of manufacturing a wide range of items out of basic raw materials.
infotexts.entitydescription.medicalfabricator: A machine that can be used to manufacture various medicines.
infotexts.entitydescription.deconstructor: Disassembles and breaks down items to reusable components and material bars.
infotexts.entitydescription.oxygenerator: Usable device for oxygen generation—must be linked to vents to work. Also recharges oxygen tanks.
infotexts.entitydescription.shuttleoxygenerator: Usable device for oxygen generation—must be linked to vents to work. Also recharges oxygen tanks.
infotexts.entitydescription.vent: Oxygen output point. Must be linked to an oxygen generator to work.
infotexts.entitydescription.reactor1: Usable device for generating electrical power.
infotexts.entitydescription.coilgun: A rapid-firing turret that propels metal bolts using electromagnets. Generally not very effective against large or heavily armored targets, but ideal for taking down smaller enemies.
infotexts.entitydescription.coilgunloader: Feeds coilgun ammunition into a linked coilgun.
infotexts.entitydescription.depthchargetube: Deploys a depth charge or decoy.
infotexts.entitydescription.depthchargeloader: Feeds depth charges and decoys into a linked depth charge tube.
infotexts.entitydescription.dischargecoil: Produces a harmful localized electrical shock across a portion of the adjacent hull.
infotexts.entitydescription.railgun: A heavy turret that uses electromagnetic force to launch shells at very high velocities. Requires very large surges of power (usually supplied by supercapacitors) and has a low rate of fire, and as such it's most often used against large and heavily armored targets.
infotexts.entitydescription.periscope: A device that can be used to observe the outside of the sub by connecting it to a camera, or to control weapons such as the railgun and coilgun.
infotexts.entitydescription.railgunloader: Feeds railgun ammunition into a linked railgun.
infotexts.entitydescription.railgunloadersinglever: Feeds railgun ammunition into a linked railgun. Single shot version.
infotexts.entitydescription.railgunloadersinglehor: Feeds railgun ammunition into a linked railgun. Single shot version.
infotexts.entitydescription.idcard: Allows limited access to areas of the sub.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienpistol: A handgun powered by alien power cells.
infotexts.entitydescription.captainscap: A token of the captain's unquestionable authority.
infotexts.entitydescription.captainsuniform: Makes you look like you might be in charge.
infotexts.entitydescription.healthscanner: A heads-up display that shows information about the vital signs and status of nearby humans.
infotexts.entitydescription.doctorsuniform: Makes you look like you might be useful in a medical emergency.
infotexts.entitydescription.orangejumpsuit: The fire-resistant fabric offers some protection against fires.
infotexts.entitydescription.bluejumpsuit: The fire-resistant fabric offers some protection against fires.
infotexts.entitydescription.toolbox: A portable container for storing tools
infotexts.entitydescription.headset: Allows remote communication among the crew.
infotexts.entitydescription.watchmanclothes: Makes you look like you might offer a mission to a passerby at any moment.
infotexts.entitydescription.bodyarmor: While the body armor won't offer adequate protection against most of the inhabitants of the subsurface ocean, it can be extremely useful if there are traitors on board.
infotexts.entitydescription.ballistichelmet: While the helmet won't offer adequate protection against most of the inhabitants of the subsurface ocean, it can be extremely useful if there are traitors on board.
infotexts.entitydescription.divingmask: Small enough to carry around in case it's needed, but won't protect you from the water pressure in the event of a full-blown hull breach.
infotexts.entitydescription.divingsuit: An atmospheric diving suit capable of withstanding the immense pressure under Europa's crust.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibleeding1: Basic bandages, useful in the treatment of bleeding wounds and burns.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibleeding2: A synthetic skin with hemostatic properties, able to quickly seal most wounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibleeding3: An antibiotic glue with hemostatic properties. Seals bleeding wounds almost immediately and treats burns very effectively. Use with care as it may cause mobile clots in the bloodstream.
infotexts.entitydescription.weldingtool: One of the most crucial tools on board the submarine. Also works underwater.
infotexts.entitydescription.plasmacutter: Cuts through various materials using a jet of ionized oxygen.
infotexts.entitydescription.screwdriver: Makes electrical repairs and rewiring possible.
infotexts.entitydescription.crowbar: Forces doors and hatches open. Also a blunt weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.sonarbeacon: Produces a localized signal that can be detected by a sonar monitor, handheld sonar, or navigation terminal.
infotexts.entitydescription.flare: Temporary handheld light. Useful for marking a path while exploring outside the sub.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienflare: Temporary handheld light. Useful for marking a path while exploring outside the sub. Burns for longer than a regular flare.
infotexts.entitydescription.uex: A simple explosive compound made of sodium and phosphorus.
infotexts.entitydescription.ic4block: A compound made of C-4 and incendium.
infotexts.entitydescription.detonator: A device that detonates any contained explosive when receiving a signal.
infotexts.entitydescription.spear: A harpoon for the harpoon gun.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienspear: A harpoon for the harpoon gun, made of alien material.
infotexts.entitydescription.explosivespear: A harpoon for the harpoon gun.
infotexts.entitydescription.harpoongun: Launches harpoons, explosive harpoons, and alien harpoons.
infotexts.entitydescription.syringegun: Launches syrettes containing drugs or poisons.
infotexts.entitydescription.stungrenade: Produces bright light and a loud sound on detonation, which stuns nearby characters.
infotexts.entitydescription.fraggrenade: General purpose fragmentation grenade. Use carefully.
infotexts.entitydescription.stunbaton: If verbal orders are insufficient, a high-voltage shock from a stun baton may be enough to beat an unruly crew member into submission.
infotexts.entitydescription.batterycell: Used as a power source for various handheld devices. Most submarines have several stationary backup batteries with recharge docks for battery cells.
infotexts.entitydescription.fulguriumbatterycell: A battery cell constructed of the rare and poorly understood compound Fulgurium.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienarmor: A body armor fabricated from an alien metamaterial.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienhelmet: A helmet fabricated from an alien metamaterial.
infotexts.entitydescription.junctionbox: Serves as a hub for power distribution and relaying signals between devices.
infotexts.entitydescription.battery: Generally used for storing backup power in case of a reactor failure.
infotexts.entitydescription.shuttlebattery: Generally used for storing backup power in case of a reactor failure.
infotexts.entitydescription.supercapacitor: Can deliver charge much faster than batteries.
infotexts.entitydescription.chargingdock: A wall-mounted battery cell charging dock.
infotexts.entitydescription.fpgacircuit: Field-programmable gate array—a multipurpose circuit that can be reconfigured for use in a large variety of electrical devices.
infotexts.entitydescription.andcomponent: Sends a signal when both inputs receive a signal within a set period of each other.
infotexts.entitydescription.addercomponent: Outputs the sum of the received signals.
infotexts.entitydescription.orcomponent: Sends a signal if either of the inputs receives a signal.
infotexts.entitydescription.notcomponent: Sends a signal when the input is NOT receiving a signal.
infotexts.entitydescription.relaycomponent: When switched on, forwards all received signals from the input connections to the outputs.
infotexts.entitydescription.delaycomponent: Delays all received signals for a specific amount of time.
infotexts.entitydescription.equalscomponent: Sends a signal when both inputs receive the same signal.
infotexts.entitydescription.greatercomponent: Sends a signal if the value the signal_in1 input is larger than the signal_in2 input.
infotexts.entitydescription.colorcomponent: Outputs a combined color signal for light control.
infotexts.entitydescription.subtractcomponent: Outputs the subtracted value of the received signals.
infotexts.entitydescription.multiplycomponent: Outputs the product of the received signals.
infotexts.entitydescription.dividecomponent: Outputs the divided value of the received signals.
infotexts.entitydescription.xorcomponent: Sends a signal if either of the inputs, but not both, receives a signal.
infotexts.entitydescription.memorycomponent: Outputs a stored value that can be updated from other sources. Use the signal_in connection to set the stored value, and the signal_store input to toggle whether the received signals should be stored.
infotexts.entitydescription.oxygendetector: Sends out a value between 0-100 depending on the quality of the surrounding air.
infotexts.entitydescription.waterdetector: Sends out a signal when the detector is submerged.
infotexts.entitydescription.smokedetector: Sends out a signal when it senses smoke.
infotexts.entitydescription.motiondetector: Sends out a signal when it detects movement.
infotexts.entitydescription.signalcheckcomponent: Sends a signal when a signal matching a specific value is received.
infotexts.entitydescription.regexcomponent: Sends a signal if the received signal matches a specific regular expression pattern.
infotexts.entitydescription.oscillator: Sends out a periodic, oscillating signal.
infotexts.entitydescription.wificomponent: Allows remote communication between other wifi components that are using the same channel.
infotexts.entitydescription.camera: Typically used in photonics masts to provide the crew with a high-resolution view of the area outside the sub.
infotexts.entitydescription.button: Produces a signal that can be used to toggle the state of equipment and doors.
infotexts.entitydescription.switch: Produces a constant signal that can be used to change the state of equipment and doors.
infotexts.entitydescription.emergencylight: Wall-mounted lighting. Requires no electrical input.
infotexts.entitydescription.wire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
infotexts.entitydescription.redwire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
infotexts.entitydescription.bluewire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
infotexts.entitydescription.orangewire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
infotexts.entitydescription.greenwire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
infotexts.entitydescription.blackwire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
infotexts.entitydescription.brownwire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
infotexts.entitydescription.lightcomponent: General purpose lighting. Requires no electrical input.
infotexts.entitydescription.emergencysiren: Can be triggered to make a terrible noise.
infotexts.entitydescription.alarmbuzzer: Can be triggered to make a terrible noise.
infotexts.entitydescription.beacon: When deployed and activated in the correct location, it will signal colonists to come and set up an outpost.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienblood: Blood extracted from a Europan lifeform. Can be further processed into a blood substitute for the treatment of blood loss.
infotexts.entitydescription.huskeggs: Dormant eggs of the Europan lifeform colloquially referred to as 'husk parasite'.
infotexts.entitydescription.carbon: Most commonly used in the manufacture of steel and plastic.
infotexts.entitydescription.iron: Can be used in the manufacture of simple tools, or refined into steel by mixing it with carbon.
infotexts.entitydescription.tin: Most commonly used in the manufacture of various electrical components.
infotexts.entitydescription.lead: Most commonly used in the manufacture of various types of ammunition.
infotexts.entitydescription.phosphorus: Used in the manufacture of lamps, explosives and some medical compounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.copper: Most commonly used in the manufacture of electrical wiring.
infotexts.entitydescription.zinc: Most commonly used in the manufacture of batteries and tonic liquid.
infotexts.entitydescription.sodium: Medical fabricators can combine sodium and chloride to create a saline solution, which can be used as a treatment for blood loss or as an ingredient for more complex medicine.
infotexts.entitydescription.silicon: Used as an ingredient in aluminum alloys, plastic and various electrical components.
infotexts.entitydescription.uranium: Can be refined in a fabricator to create fuel rods for a nuclear reactor, or used in the manufacture of nuclear weapons.
infotexts.entitydescription.potassium: Used in the manufacture of explosives and medical compounds. Reacts violently when in contact with water.
infotexts.entitydescription.magnesium: Used in the manufacture of explosives and medical compounds. Reacts violently when in contact with water.
infotexts.entitydescription.lithium: Most commonly used in the manufacture of batteries and antipsychotic drugs.
infotexts.entitydescription.chlorine: Most commonly used in saline, a common treatment for blood loss, and chloral hydrate, a powerful sedative.
infotexts.entitydescription.slimebacteria: A colony of myxobacteria. Can be processed into antibiotics.
infotexts.entitydescription.titanite: A mineral containing titanium and iron.
infotexts.entitydescription.brockite: A mineral containing titanium and phosphorus.
infotexts.entitydescription.amblygonite: A mineral composed of lithium, aluminum and sodium.
infotexts.entitydescription.sphalerite: A mineral consisting largely of zinc in crystalline form.
infotexts.entitydescription.quartz: A crystalline mineral composed of silicon.
infotexts.entitydescription.diamond: A crystal composed of solid carbon.
infotexts.entitydescription.hydroxyapatite: A mineral composed of calcium and phosphorus.
infotexts.entitydescription.uraniumore: A mineral containing large concentrations of uranium.
infotexts.entitydescription.stannite: A mineral composed of copper, iron and tin.
infotexts.entitydescription.esperite: A mineral composed of zinc and lead.
infotexts.entitydescription.galena: A mineral mostly consisting of lead.
infotexts.entitydescription.langbeinite: A mineral consisting of potassium and magnesium.
infotexts.entitydescription.chamosite: A mineral consisting of iron and aluminum.
infotexts.entitydescription.ironore: A mineral containing large amounts of iron.
infotexts.entitydescription.polyhalite: A mineral consisting of potassium and calcium.
infotexts.entitydescription.sylvite: A mineral containing potassium and sodium.
infotexts.entitydescription.lazulite: A mineral containing phosphorus and iron.
infotexts.entitydescription.opium: A relatively mild opioid obtained from aquatic poppy. Most commonly used to manufacture morphine and fentanyl.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibiotics: A mild antibiotic that acts against a wide range of disease-causing bacteria, though with the side effect of internal damage. Used as an ingredient in many medical compounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.stabilozine: Used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. On its own, can be mildly useful in the treatment of internal damage and burns, and slightly more effective for oxygen deprivation.
infotexts.entitydescription.ethanol: Medical alcohol used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. Drinking while on duty is not advised.
infotexts.entitydescription.sulphuricacid: A strong acid that causes burns when in contact with skin. Used as an ingredient in several poisons.
infotexts.entitydescription.antidama1: A powerful opiate for treating pain associated with internal injuries, but will cause shortness of breath and eventual dependency with overuse.
infotexts.entitydescription.antidama2: A powerful opiate for treating pain associated with internal injuries, but will cause shortness of breath and eventual dependency with overuse.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibloodloss1: A sodium chloride infusion mildly useful in the treatment of blood loss.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibloodloss2: A pack of blood substitute for the treatment of blood loss.
infotexts.entitydescription.deusizine: A highly potent stimulant effective in the treatment of internal damage, oxygen deprivation and, to a lesser extent, blood loss. Produces mild burns as a side effect.
infotexts.entitydescription.calyxanide: An antiparasitic drug used in the treatment of husk parasite infections. Might require higher dosage to cure the infection at later stages.
infotexts.entitydescription.antinarc: An opioid antagonist for the treatment of opiate-based withdrawal and overdose.
infotexts.entitydescription.morbusineantidote: An antidote for acute morbusine poisoning.
infotexts.entitydescription.cyanideantidote: An antidote for acute cyanide poisoning.
infotexts.entitydescription.sufforinantidote: An antidote for acute sufforin poisoning.
infotexts.entitydescription.deliriumineantidote: An antidote for acute deliriumine poisoning.
infotexts.entitydescription.antirad: Slows down cellular degradation caused by radiation.
infotexts.entitydescription.liquidoxygenite: A mildly toxic solution that slowly releases oxygen into the bloodstream when injected. Avoid dropping.
infotexts.entitydescription.tonicliquid: A medical solution that's mildly effective as a treatment for internal damage, but most commonly used as an ingredient in more complex medical compounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.steroids: Temporarily increases muscular strength and physical performance.
infotexts.entitydescription.hyperzine: An extremely potent muscle stimulant for those moments when you gotta go fast.
infotexts.entitydescription.chloralhydrate: A sedative that can be used to knock someone out for a short period of time.
infotexts.entitydescription.nitroglycerin: A highly unstable liquid that may explode when subjected to heat or physical shock.
infotexts.entitydescription.fiberplant: This plant has the texture of a coconut and its fibers move on their own under your fingers unnervingly. Useful for crafting.
infotexts.entitydescription.elastinplant: The foliage of this plant cannot be torn, only stretched. Useful for crafting.
infotexts.entitydescription.aquaticpoppy: It's warm to the touch. Useful for crafting.
infotexts.entitydescription.yeastshroom: The smell is beyond belief, like rotting meat on a hot day. Useful for crafting.
infotexts.entitydescription.elastin: A highly elastic, naturally occurring protein. Useful for crafting.
infotexts.entitydescription.adrenaline: A naturally occurring hormone. Useful for crafting.
infotexts.entitydescription.swimbladder: Many Europan lifeforms have a swim bladder containing tissue fluids that can be easily processed into stabilozine and saline.
infotexts.entitydescription.adrenalinegland: Contains large amounts of adrenaline, which can be extracted using a deconstructor.
infotexts.entitydescription.suppliescabinet: Storage for small- and medium-sized items.
infotexts.entitydescription.mediumsteelcabinet: Storage for small- and medium-sized items.
infotexts.entitydescription.mediumwindowedsteelcab: Storage for small- and medium-sized items.
infotexts.entitydescription.steelcabinet: Storage for small- and medium-sized items.
infotexts.entitydescription.securesteelcabinet: Lockable storage for small- and medium-sized items.
infotexts.entitydescription.railgunshellrack: A way to neatly stow railgun shells.
infotexts.entitydescription.coilgunammoshelf: A way to neatly stow coilgun ammunition.
infotexts.entitydescription.divingsuitlocker: A diving suit locker with one dive-ready suit.
infotexts.entitydescription.metalcrate: A vessel in which items may be stored.
infotexts.entitydescription.securemetalcrate: A secure vessel in which items may be stored.
infotexts.entitydescription.explosivecrate: A vessel in which explosives may be stored.
infotexts.entitydescription.chemicalcrate: A vessel in which chemicals may be stored.
infotexts.entitydescription.extinguisherbracket: Holds a fire extinguisher to the wall.
infotexts.entitydescription.weaponholder: A place to stow your weapons neatly.
infotexts.entitydescription.windoweddoor: A sliding door with integrated window.
infotexts.entitydescription.hatch: A door, but on the horizontal axis.
infotexts.entitydescription.dockingport: A vertically aligned docking interface. Locks to another docking port to form a watertight seal and allow passage between subs, shuttles and locations.
infotexts.entitydescription.dockinghatch: A horizontally aligned docking interface. Locks to another docking hatch to form a watertight seal and allow passage between subs, shuttles and locations.
infotexts.entitydescription.ductblock: A mechanically operated vent that may be opened or closed to allow the passage of water.
infotexts.entityname.label: Label
infotexts.entitydescription.label: Decorative text label.
infotexts.entitydescription.fuelrod: A bar of enriched uranium, for use within a reactor.
infotexts.entitydescription.fulguriumfuelrod: A bar of enriched fulgurium, for use within a reactor. Generates significantly more heat and lasts longer than uranium fuel rods.
infotexts.entitydescription.thoriumfuelrod: A thorium bar, for use within a reactor. Generates slightly more heat and lasts longer than uranium fuel rods.
infotexts.entitydescription.depthchargeshell: A barrel of explosives. Will sink and then explode.
infotexts.entitydescription.nucleardepthcharge: A barrel of really big explosives. Will sink and then explode.
infotexts.entitydescription.depthdecoyshell: A decoy that can be deployed via the depth charge launcher. Will sink while producing a loud acoustic signal to attract attention away from the sub.
infotexts.entitydescription.nucleardepthdecoy: A decoy that can be deployed via the depth charge launcher. Will sink while producing a loud acoustic signal to attract attention away from the sub.
infotexts.entitydescription.nuclearshell: A nuclear shell for use with a railgun.
infotexts.entitydescription.alientrinket1: Minor artifact found in alien ruins.
infotexts.entitydescription.alientrinket2: Minor artifact found in alien ruins.
infotexts.entitydescription.alientrinket3: Minor artifact found in alien ruins.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienhatch: A horizontal hatch for alien ruins.
infotexts.entitydescription.aliendoor: A vertical door for alien ruins.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienmotionsensor: A motion detector used by aliens.
infotexts.entitydescription.aliengenerator: Converts alien power cells to electricity.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienpump: Used to pump water in and out of ruins.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienbutton: Sends a signal to alien mechanisms.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienturret: A stationary turret found in alien ruins.
infotexts.entitydescription.aliencoil: Discharges electricity; used in alien ruins.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienlightcomponent: Emits light; used in alien ruins.
infotexts.label.letwaterdrain: Let all water drain before exiting
infotexts.autoloadout_description: Modify the quantity of items to be spawned on the sub initially
infotexts.submarine.description.humpback: A former military vessel, WH4-L3 'Humpback' has been outfitted to withstand most of the dangers in deep Europa. Her relatively high velocity is offset by low maneuverability. As she's still boasting an older model reactor, power needs to be supplemented by a backup battery array or the crew will find themselves unable to run all of the new equipment.
infotexts.submarine.description.bunyip: Latest in the line of personnel transports, Bunyip is capable of ferrying crew between submarines and installations. Its operating radius is considerably lower than its more advanced cousins and no weapons on board makes it vulnerable to attacks.
infotexts.submarine.description.muikku: The workhorse of the colonies, these little shuttles have good speed and dive/ascent characteristics, but they are fragile and their low-capacity batteries limit their range somewhat.
infotexts.submarine.description.orca: With a relatively high top speed and fantastic ascent and descent characteristics due to her 3 large ballast tanks, Orca class subs are agile vessels, let down only by their small compliment of weapons, unreliable engine and reactors with a greater than average hunger for fuel.
infotexts.submarine.description.remora: A range of customization options are available for Remora. In this model, some of the main hull space has been replaced by a detachable ballast and a remote-controlled drone. A large crew is needed to operate this submarine.
infotexts.submarine.description.typhon: Typhon class subs are known for their brutish appearance, reasonable array of light and heavy firepower, and their general dependability. Any captain should be aware of their poor rate of descent and unimpressive top speed.
infotexts.submarine.description.dugong: Compared to larger vessels, the Dugong series is overshadowed in all aspects except one: their reliability for their price is world class. They're lacking in firepower and speed, so smart maneuvering is key.
infotexts.submarine.description.selkie: The workhorse of the colonies, these little shuttles have good speed and dive/ascent characteristics, but they are fragile and their low-capacity batteries limit their range somewhat.
infotexts.submarine.description.venture: Originally intended as research vessels, Venture shuttles have been co-opted as a more robust alternative for travel between outposts and submarines.
infotexts.submarine.description.berilia: Berilia is top of the line when it comes to mass and firepower. Its two engines and three ballasts require a copious amount of power to operate, and keeping the machinery in condition is a handful for even a moderately large crew.
infotexts.linkwaypoint: Hold space to link to another waypoint
infotexts.idcarddescriptiontooltip: Characters spawning at this spawnpoint will have the specified description added to their ID card. This can be used to describe additional access levels their card has on the sub.
infotexts.idcardtagstooltip: Characters spawning at this spawnpoint will have the specified tags added to their ID card. You can, for example, use these tags to limit access to some parts of the sub.
infotexts.spawnpointjobstooltip: Only characters with the specified job will spawn at this spawnpoint.
infotexts.reloadlinkedsubtooltip: Reload the linked submarine from the specified file
infotexts.linklinkedsub: Hold space to link to a docking port
infotexts.spamfilterkicked: You have been kicked by the spam filter.
infotexts.spamfilterblocked: You have been blocked by the spam filter. Try again after 10 seconds.
infotexts.reactortipfissionrate: Increasing the fission rate makes the reactor consume more fuel and generate more heat. The heat is used to spin the turbine, which generates electricity.
infotexts.reactortipturbineoutput: The higher the turbine output, the more the reactor attempts to generate electricity. If the output is too high relative to the fission rate, the reactor will cool down, and if too low, it will overheat.
infotexts.reactortiptemperature: The temperature of the reactor core. The temperature is optimal when the bar is between the red indicators.
infotexts.reactortipload: How much power is currently being consumed by the devices connected to the reactor.
infotexts.reactortippower: How much power is currently being generated by the reactor.
infotexts.reactortipautotemp: When automatic control is on, the reactor will automatically adjust itself according to the power consumption. However, the system is not fast enough to react to large fluctuations in power consumption, so manual adjustments may still be needed.
infotexts.steeringautopilotmaintainpostip: AUTOPILOT ON\nMaintaining position. Choose the position to maintain by clicking on the display.
infotexts.steeringautopilotlocationtip: AUTOPILOT ON\nAutopilot is set to navigate towards [locationname].
infotexts.sonartipactive: When active sonar is on, the transponders send out pings that reflect from nearby obstacles. The pings may also be heard by hostile creatures or enemy submarines.
infotexts.sonartippassive: In passive mode, the sonar only listens to sources of sound and sounds reflected from nearby obstacles without actively sending out pings.
infotexts.powertransfertipovervoltage: When the electrical grid is supplied more power than what is being consumed, the voltage rises, which may cause damage to electrical devices.
infotexts.powertransfertiplowvoltage: When there's not enough power available, the voltage drops, which may cause some devices to shut down.
infotexts.powertransfertipload: How much power is currently being consumed by the devices connected to the electrical grid.
infotexts.powertransfertippower: How much power is currently being supplied to the electrical grid.
infotexts.healthitemusetip: Drop items here to use them on the selected limb. You can also use items with the inventory hotkeys or by double clicking.
infotexts.lowmedicalskillwarning: Low medical skill! The suitable treatments list may be inaccurate.
infotexts.healthlimbname.head: Head
infotexts.traitorstartmessage: You are the traitor! Your secret task is to assassinate [targetname]! Discretion is of utmost concern; sinking the submarine and killing the entire crew will arouse suspicion amongst the fleet. If possible, make the death look like an accident.
infotexts.traitormoreagentsmessage:
It is possible that there are other agents on this submarine. You don't know their names, but you do have a method of communication. Use the code words to greet the agent and code response to respond. Disguise such words in a normal-sounding phrase so the crew doesn't suspect anything.

The code words are: [codewords].
The code response is: [coderesponse].
infotexts.traitorstartmessageserver: [traitorname] is the traitor and the target is [targetname].
infotexts.traitorendmessagesuccess: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task was successful.
infotexts.traitorendmessagesuccesstraitordead: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task was successful, but the traitor did not make it out alive either.
infotexts.traitorendmessagesuccesstraitordetained: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task was successful, but the traitor was successfully detained.
infotexts.traitorendmessagefailure: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task was unsuccessful.
infotexts.traitorendmessagefailuretraitordead: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname], but [genderpronoun] got [genderpronounreflexive] killed before completing it.
infotexts.traitorendmessagefailuretraitordetained: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task failed—[genderpronoun] was successfully detained.
infotexts.traitorrespawnmessage: Your traitor objective was unsuccessful. You are no longer a traitor, so play nice!
infotexts.traitortargetmessage: [traitorname] had a secret objective to assassinate you—and the task was successful.
infotexts.self_causeofdeathdescription.damage: You have succumbed to your injuries.
infotexts.self_causeofdeathdescription.pressure: You have been crushed by water pressure.
infotexts.self_causeofdeathdescription.husk: The parasite has taken over your body.
infotexts.self_causeofdeathdescription.disconnecte: You were disconnected from the server.
infotexts.giveinhelpmultiplayer: Let go of your character and enter spectator mode (other players will no longer be able to revive you)
infotexts.giveinhelpsingleplayer: The character can no longer be revived if you give in.
infotexts.deathchatnotification: Your chat messages will only be visible to other dead players.
infotexts.dialogreactorfuel: Loading more fuel to the reactor!
infotexts.dialogreactortaken: Hands off please! I've got this!
Hey, we don't need two people at the reactor!
infotexts.dialogcantfindcontroller: I can't find a way to operate the [item]!
I don't know how to control the [item]!
infotexts.dialognobatteries: There aren't any batteries on this boat!
infotexts.dialogleakfixed: Repairing [roomname]. A few more holes to go!
infotexts.dialoggetdivinggear: Need to find a diving suit!
infotexts.dialoggetoxygentank: Need to find an oxygen tank!
infotexts.dialognofire: I don't think there's any fire to put out!
infotexts.dialogsteeringtaken: Hey, I'm at the helm now!
Hands off please! I'm steering now!
Hey, we don't need two people to steer!
infotexts.dialogsonartarget: A target on the sonar at [direction]!
A blip on the sonar at [direction]!
infotexts.dialogsonartargetlarge: A large target on the sonar at [direction]!
Something big on the sonar at [direction]!
infotexts.dialognorepairtargets: What do you mean? Everything is working all right.
infotexts.dialognopumps: The pumps are okay, aren't they?
None of the pumps require attention at the moment.
infotexts.orderdialogself.operatereactor: I'll take care of the reactor!
infotexts.orderdialog.steer.navigatetodestination: [name], set the course to our destination!
infotexts.orderdialog.chargebatteries.charge: [name], make sure all batteries are charged!
infotexts.orderdialog.rescue: [name], give medical aid to anyone in need!
infotexts.orderdialogself.rescue: I'll give medical aid to anyone in need!
infotexts.orderdialogself.repairsystems: I'll take care of broken devices!
infotexts.orderdialogself.repairsystems.jobspecifi: I'll take care of broken devices!
infotexts.orderdialog.repairsystems.all: [name], repair any damaged systems! I don't care if you don't have the skills—do your best!
[name], try to fix any broken devices, even if it's something you're not trained for!
[name], repair any damaged devices! Anything you can—I don't care about your training now!
infotexts.orderdialogself.repairsystems.all: I'll take care of broken devices!
infotexts.orderdialog.reportbrokendevices: Need someone to repair devices in [roomname]!
infotexts.orderoptions.steer: Maintain position, Navigate back, Navigate to destination
infotexts.huskdormant: It feels as if something was stuck in your throat
infotexts.huskcantspeak: You feel something moving in your throat. You try to scream but no sound comes out.
infotexts.huskactivate: A strange chitinous appendage bursts out from your mouth. Use it to inject eggs into a living body by pressing [Attack]!
infotexts.doormsgcannotopen: This door is controlled by buttons or remote controllers wired to it.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.internaldamage: The area is an ugly shade of purple, and apparently very painful to touch. You suspect a bone might be broken.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.internaldamag: You have succumbed to your internal injuries.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.bleeding: Blood pours freely from this ragged and particularly nasty open wound.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.burn: The area is blistered and red, and skin is already beginning to peel away in sheets. The patient is in a great deal of pain.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.oxygenlow: The skin is pale and clammy, and the lips turning blue.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.bloodloss: The patient is pale and cold. Their heart beats in an alarmingly rapid fashion.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.stun: The patient is dazed and unresponsive.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.pressure: There is obvious massive organ damage and the blood vessels of the eye have burst, creating an unnerving red gaze.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.pressure: You have been crushed by water pressure.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.huskinfection: Something dark and unpleasant moves in the mouth. They are rendered completely mute, save for occasional clicking sounds apparently emanating from deep within the throat.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeath.huskinfection: Taken over by a husk parasite.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.huskinfection: You have been taken over by the husk parasite.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.psychosis: The patient rants and mutters in an agitated fashion, a steady commentary of unseen events.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.drunk: The smell of alcohol rises from them like a vapor, their speech slurs a little, and their eyes fail to focus.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.drunk: You have died of alcohol poisoning.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.opiatewithdrawal: Agitation and a tremor are obvious, as are the signs of nausea.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.opiatewithdra: You have died of opiate withdrawal.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.opiateoverdose: The patient has pinpoint pupils and icy cold skin. They struggle to breathe and swallow.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.opiateoverdos: You have died of opiate overdose.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.opiateaddiction: The patient is happy enough...so long as they get what they need.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.gunshotwound: The entry site is a small, dark, bruised hole oozing a little blood. The exit wound, however, is a large ragged mess of exposed tissue, and it's pouring blood.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.gunshotwound: You have died of gunshot wounds.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.morbusinepoisoning: The patient can't breathe at all, and their heart rate is slowing rapidly.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.morbusinepois: You have died of morbusine poisoning.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sufforinpoisoning: Without prompt treatment, sufforine poisoning leads to delusions and rapid death.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.sufforinpoiso: You have died of sufforin poisoning.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.cyanidepoisoning: The patient is confused and has trouble breathing. Their skin is red and they have occasional muscle spasms.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.cyanidepoison: You have died of cyanide poisoning.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.haste: Movement speed and reflexes are heightened.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.huskinfectionresis: Patient's immune system is more attuned to alien parasites.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.pressureresistance: Internal organs are more accustomed to high pressures.
infotexts.jobdescription.captain: The commanding officer is responsible for commanding the entirety of the crew and ensuring that everything is running smoothly.
infotexts.jobdescription.engineer: Engineers are the backbone of a submarine's crew, complementing a mechanic's mechanical engineering skill with their knowledge of electrical engineering. They are capable of performing maintenance on the various electrical pieces of the submarine.
infotexts.jobdescription.mechanic: Mechanics are capable of fixing various mechanical devices with their high mechanical engineering skill. Together with engineers they ensure a submarine is working to its fullest.
infotexts.jobdescription.securityofficer: Security Officers are responsible for keeping the submarine safe from threats, both external and internal. The creatures inhabiting the ocean aren't the only threat they need to worry about, as several of the renegade groups opposing the Europa Coalition are known to have sent infiltrators on board the vessels.
infotexts.jobdescription.medicaldoctor: Although usually taken for granted, doctors play an important role on the submarine, possessing the required skill to treat injured or unconscious crew members. Their skills can also be useful for creating various non-medicinal chemicals.
infotexts.jobdescription.assistant: Assistants don't have any specific responsibilities or areas of expertise. This job is a good choice for newcomers who want to get a hang of working on board the submarine without taking up tasks that they aren't qualified for.
infotexts.locationchange.none.changeto.outpost: A new outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.locationchange.none.changeto.military: A new military outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.locationchange.none.changeto.research: A new research outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.locationchange.ruins.changeto.outpost: An outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.locationchange.ruins.changeto.military: A military outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.locationchange.ruins.changeto.research: A research outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.tutorial.tryagain: Do you want to try again?
infotexts.tutorial.radio.speaker: Captain Huskinson
infotexts.tutorial.mechanictitle: Mechanic - Glue, duct tape and your nerve are the only things keeping the crew alive.
infotexts.tutorial.mechanicdescription: When the plan goes as planned and the gear works is as probable as the human race leaving this shithole. There are no breaks or rest for you, as everything that can break down, will break down. And if nothing’s broken, then it's maintenance, maintenance, maintenance. Getting to the next destination is all that matters, and you’re the one who delivers. There’s no thank-yous or respect, just snickering and contempt from your fellow crew members—but that’s okay. This is YOUR survival vessel, and if any of them make it too, well...whoop dee doo for them.
infotexts.tutorial.engineertitle: Engineer - The one who harnesses the power of nature.
infotexts.tutorial.engineerdescription: Power and oxygen, it's like that. Without, the ship don’t move and the lungs won’t breathe. Beyond the fancy talk and costume play, you are the guy who really runs the ship, get it? Trust in the laws of physics and think clear. Also, keep your eye on that damn toy-tinkering wannabe engineer mechanic, and whatever you do, don’t bite into the psycho-babble of the medic. He’s so deep in his softie inner world he’s practically a woman. Captain and security are harmless, and way below your intelligence. Obviously.
infotexts.tutorial.securityofficertitle: Security Officer - The backbone of violence.
infotexts.tutorial.securityofficerdescription: It is said that pressure brings out the worst in people. Not everybody has your moral strength—hell, most of them are so crooked that it’s questionable if they even should be allowed to live. Channel the crew’s anger toward the creatures outside, but never fool yourself into trusting them. Keep the nukes ready, the handcuffs available, and every now and then put someone in the brig just so they know who’s in charge!
infotexts.tutorial.medicaldoctortitle: Medical Doctor - Maintaining the key resource: the people
infotexts.tutorial.medicaldoctordescription: Guns and engines and reactors don't keep the ship running—people do. It’s up to you to keep the gunner alive to man the guns and captain alive to steer the ship. And remember, your job goes well beyond the physical. We live crammed into tight spaces, under ice, in the sea. When the lights go out and your buddies go to sleep, all kinds of dark shit crawls into their minds. Keep them alive and sane, or put them down like dogs. It’s up to you.
infotexts.tutorial.captaintitle: Captain - Naval visionary, seafarer, a genius. Possibly.
infotexts.tutorial.captaindescription: Captain Ahab once said, Hell is an idea first born on an undigested apple-dumpling. Do you know what that means? No. Does the crew think you are a mysterious genius? Hell yeah. This job is at least as much appearing to know what to do as actually knowing what to do. You are the map and the compass, the guy with the big picture. Navigate and make the tough calls. And remember, you’re just a few steps away from being the mayor of an outpost, and if a couple fellows need to die for that—so be it!
infotexts.tutorial.airlockdescription:
Every submarine should be equipped with a secure airlock where the crew can exit the sub safely and without too much flooding.

To safely exit the submarine, equip a diving suit and other necessary items (usually a handheld sonar, weapons and extra oxygen tank or two). Then make your way to the airlock. Be sure to close all the doors behind you to stop the water’s flow before too much of it gets inside.

When coming back inside, use water pumps to drain all of the water before going deeper into the submarine. It is also helpful to return all of the equipment back to their proper places and refill used oxygen tanks at the oxygen generator.
infotexts.tutorial.railgundescription: The railgun works like a coil gun, except it fires big shells that can be upgraded with explosives.\n\nRailgun loaders are loaded with single railgun shells instead of boxes of ammunition. Otherwise, operating them is the same: interact with the periscope to aim with the turret, then press {0} to fire. Press {1} to stop aiming.
infotexts.tutorial.syringegundescription: A ranged weapon of choice for medics, the syringe gun uses medicine as ammunition. This allows for administering cures from afar. Be aware: medicines fired from long range are less effective than those used in the medical interface.\n\nA tactical choice in combat would be to load the syringe gun with poison and fire it at enemies. Aim the syringe gun the same way you would other long-range weapons: {0} to aim, {1} to fire.
infotexts.tutorial.plasmacutterdescription: The plasma cutter is a device used to cut through walls and doors. It functions like the welding tool: {0} to aim, {1} to fire.\n\nWhile the plasma cutter is primarily a tool, it does inflict burns on anyone who gets in the way, which makes it a handy makeshift weapon.
infotexts.tutorial.crowbardescription: A heavy instrument that can be used to force open doors. Handy when someone has been tampering with door wiring or when you need to get to rooms you’re not allowed in. Use ({0}) the crowbar on a closed door to start prying it open. The crowbar must be equipped to do this.
infotexts.tutorial.mineralsdescription: The basic materials for crafting can be bought, deconstructed or found in the world.\n\nMinerals are spawned in the cave and ice walls, and they can be cut out using the plasma cutter and then picked up. Raw minerals can be deconstructed to create craftable elements.
infotexts.tutorial.psychosisdescription: When in contact with certain performance-enhancing drugs or under some extraterrestrial influence, players may be afflicted with psychosis, causing them to experience visual and auditory hallucinations and phantom pains.\n\nPsychosis may be cured using haloperidol.
infotexts.tutorial.opiatesdescription: Overuse of pain medication causes addiction and, in time, withdrawal. Withdrawal symptoms can be reduced by feeding the addiction, but to truly be rid of the effects, one must either stop taking the drugs entirely or use naloxone.
infotexts.tutorial.oxygendescription: Oxygen is a valuable commodity in underwater Europa. It must be readily available during long transits aboard submarines, which is made possible by oxygen generators. They pump air through ventilation to different rooms and can be used to refill oxygen tanks.\n\nTo refill oxygen tanks, interact ([InteractType.Use]) with the generator to open its inventory. Insert an empty oxygen tank into one of the slots to start refilling it. When the tank is full, drag it back to your inventory or into your diving suit/mask.
infotexts.tutorial.ladderdescription: To grab onto a ladder, press {0}. Use {1} and {2} buttons to climb the ladder. Let go of the ladder by pressing {3} again.
infotexts.mechanic.radio.wakeup: Are you okay? You need to get up and moving. Get to the sub ASAP!
infotexts.mechanic.radio.equipment: Remember to get your gear from the locker. Grab everything you can carry. We’re in for some rough shit.
infotexts.mechanic.radio.breach: Hey, I’m reading some hull breaches along your way. Better plug those real quick to buy us some time.
infotexts.mechanic.radio.news: All right, can you hear me? I got bad news and good news.
infotexts.mechanic.radio.fire: The bad news is there’s a fire ahead. The good news is there’s probably enough scrap nearby for you to fabricate a fire extinguisher.
infotexts.mechanic.radio.diving: You’re almost there. Just be careful—this next leak is large enough for the whole room to be pressurized. Find a diving suit. It should protect your organs against this kind of pressure.
infotexts.mechanic.radio.submarine: Welcome aboard. First thing you need to do is to check the engine and ballast pumps, see if they’re in need of maintenance.
infotexts.mechanic.radio.complete: Well done. Let’s wait for the others to make their way here. Can’t very well operate the sub with just the two of us.
infotexts.mechanic.opendoorobjective: Open the door by pushing the adjacent button
infotexts.mechanic.opendoortext: Move by pressing {0}, {1}, {2}, {3} buttons. Interact with items and devices with {4} button.\n\nOpen this door by pressing {5} while your cursor is over it.
infotexts.mechanic.equipmentobjective: Get your equipment from the locker
infotexts.mechanic.equipmenttext:
Items are stored in containers of different sizes. You can see what’s inside one by interacting with it ({0}). Transfer items between character and container inventory by dragging or double-clicking.

When in a character’s inventory, items can be equipped by double-clicking on them or by pressing the corresponding quick-slot key.

To close the interface, press {1}.
infotexts.mechanic.weldingtext: To repair leaks in hulls, equip the welding tool by double-clicking on it. Some items, like the welding tool, require two free hands to use. Unequip or drop an item by double-clicking it while it is in use.\n\nWhen welding tool is equipped, hold {0} to aim. While aiming, hold {1} to weld.
infotexts.mechanic.drainobjective: Turn on nearby pump to drain excess water
infotexts.mechanic.draintext: When the sub is flooded, use pumps to drain excess water. Usually pumps receive signals from nearby water detectors or navigation terminals, but some can be operated manually. This pump is programmed to only pump water out. Turn it on by interacting with it ({0}) and flip the switch to the “on” position.
infotexts.mechanic.deconstructtext: The fabricator is a device that can take different kinds of materials and turn them into useful items. If you don't have enough materials for fabrication, you can break down items in the deconstructor. Just drag the item into one of the top slots and press the “Deconstruct” button.\n\nIn this case, fabricating a fire extinguisher requires aluminum and sodium. Sodium is readily available, but aluminum must be deconstructed from oxygen tanks.
infotexts.mechanic.fabricatetext: Now that we have all of the required materials, we can fabricate a fire extinguisher. Find it in the list, load the fabricator with materials and press the button to start fabricating.\n\nWhen done, the fabricated item can be found in the fabricator’s output slot.
infotexts.mechanic.extinguishertext: Equip the fire extinguisher like you would a welding tool. Then aim by holding down {0} and dispense by holding down {1}.
infotexts.mechanic.dropextinguishertext: Some items, like the fire extinguisher, are too large to carry around in the character’s inventory. To unequip the fire extinguisher, drag it away from the inventory and release the mouse button.
infotexts.mechanic.divingtext: A diving suit protects the wearer from high pressure. Equip one to be able to swim outside the submarine. Make sure the suit has a full oxygen tank attached, otherwise the wearer will suffocate.
infotexts.mechanic.repairpumptext: Mechanical and electrical devices require maintenance. Without it, they will break and stop working. Repair mechanical devices by equipping a wrench and interacting ({0}) with it.\n\nItems in need of maintenance are marked with a repair icon.
infotexts.mechanic.repairsubmarineobjective: Repair the engine and ballast pumps
infotexts.mechanic.repairsubmarinetext:
You are now onboard a submarine, which is where you will spend most of your time in Barotrauma. This one is on the simpler side, but you will have a selection of different submarines available to you when you begin a game. You can take the diving suit off now. (Either by pressing and holding the unequip button on top of the equipment slot or dragging the suit away from the slot.)

Interiors of a submarine are usually cramped, and finding things can be difficult until you get your bearings.

Find the engine (usually located in the rear compartment of a submarine) and ballast pumps (in the bottom; some submarines have multiple ballast tanks).
infotexts.engineer.radio.wakeup: Get your ass up! We need power!
infotexts.engineer.radio.equipment: That last impact cut power to half of the outpost. I want you to grab what you need to get us online again.
infotexts.engineer.radio.reactorstable: We seem to be stable now. Some junction boxes blew their fuses and pumps aren’t working—you should go see what you can do about it. Remember to switch the reactor to automatic before you go.
infotexts.engineer.radio.faultywiring: Some of the wiring seems to be faulty. Find some wire and do a quick fix, otherwise we’re without power.
infotexts.engineer.radio.changeofplans: Change of plans. Come to the sub. We’re gonna blow this joint.
infotexts.engineer.radio.submarine: Looks like the electrical room’s seen better days. See if you can get it online, then start up the reactor.
infotexts.engineer.radio.complete: Good work. We may yet make it out of this alive.
infotexts.engineer.equipmenttext:
Items are stored in containers of different sizes. You can see what’s inside one by interacting with it ({0}). Transfer items between character and container inventory by dragging or double-clicking.

When in a character’s inventory, items can be equipped by double-clicking on them or by pressing the corresponding quick-slot key.

To close the interface, press {1}.
infotexts.engineer.reactortext:
Nuclear reactors provide power to submarines and outposts. They require fuel to create heat and a crew member to regulate the output.

Drag a fuel rod to the item slot on the left side. Multiple fuel rods create more heat, but in normal circumstances one is enough and any more might lead to overheating.

Start by setting the fission rate so that the needle is on green, then do the same for turbine output. You can see load and output values to the right. Try to keep the output as close to load as possible. When the output is lower it leads to power outages and, when it’s higher, overvoltage and fires.

When the reactor operator leaves the interface, it’s recommended to turn automatic control on. It responds to any fluctuations in grid load, but is considerably slower than a human operator.
infotexts.engineer.repairjunctionboxtext: Like mechanical items, junction boxes need maintenance. In addition to wear and tear, they are damaged by water and overvoltage.\n\nThey are repaired using a screwdriver, as opposed to a wrench for mechanical items. Otherwise the process is the same. Equip a screwdriver and interact ({0}) with the device to see the repair interface.
infotexts.engineer.wirejunctionboxestext:
Junction boxes serve as the main way to connect the submarine’s devices to the power grid. Connect them with wires to allow the power to travel between them.

To connect wires to items, equip a screwdriver and wire in separate hands, then interact with ({0}) the item you want to add the wire to. You will see a connection panel with a couple of connection pins and a wire sticking out from the bottom. Drag the wire to “power” pin, then press {1} to close the panel. Repeat the step at the next item.

If you don’t see a loose wire in the connection panel interface, make sure you have one equipped.
infotexts.engineer.repairelectricalroomtext: Find the sub’s electrical room and repair the junction boxes by interacting with them while holding a screwdriver, then pressing the “Repair” button.
infotexts.engineer.powerupreactortext:
Nuclear reactors provide power to submarines and outposts. They require fuel to create heat and a crew member to regulate the output.

Drag a fuel rod to the item slot on the left side. Multiple fuel rods create more heat, but in normal circumstances one is enough and any more might lead to overheating.

Start by setting the fission rate so that the needle is on green, then do the same for turbine output. You can see load and output values to the right. Try to keep the output as close to load as possible. When the output is lower it leads to power outages and, when it’s higher, overvoltage and fires.

When the reactor operator leaves the interface, it’s recommended to turn automatic control on. It responds to any fluctuations in grid load, but is considerably slower than a human operator.
infotexts.officer.radio.wakeup: Is there any security still alive? We have a hull breach and some unwanted visitors!
infotexts.officer.radio.equipment: Find what you need to take out these monsters.
infotexts.officer.radio.crawlerdead: Good job, but that was just a baby crawler. I see something bigger up ahead, so keep on your toes.
infotexts.officer.radio.somethingbig: I’m reading something big on the sonar. Load the coilgun and see if you can take it down.
infotexts.officer.radio.hammerheaddead: Nice shooting. Bad news is, this station is unsalvageable. Come down to the sub—we’re leaving before it’s too late.
infotexts.officer.radio.submarine: Welcome aboard. I need you to make sure we’re ready to deal with whatever comes after us when we leave. Start inspecting the weaponry.
infotexts.officer.radio.complete: Outstanding. Now get ready. Once the rest of the crew arrives, we’re out of here.
infotexts.officer.equipmenttext:
Items are stored in containers of different sizes. You can see what’s inside one by interacting with it ({0}). Transfer items between character and container inventory by dragging or double-clicking.

When in a character’s inventory, items can be equipped by double-clicking on them or by pressing the corresponding quick-slot key.

To close the interface, press {1}.
infotexts.officer.meleeweaponobjective: Equip a melee weapon and protective gear
infotexts.officer.meleeweapontext: Equip a weapon by double-clicking it in your inventory. Weapons require at least one free hand. Wearable equipment can either be double-clicked or dragged into their corresponding slots in the character inventory.\n\nReady the weapon by holding {0} and swing it by clicking {1}.
infotexts.officer.crawlertext: There's a monster in the next room. A crawler. Take it down using the stun baton. Stun baton stuns enemies for a brief moment, so use that to your advantage.
infotexts.officer.somethingbigobjective: Load coilgun and turn on the supercapacitor
infotexts.officer.somethingbigtext:
Coilguns are standard-issue equipment in most subs. They require short bursts of power and boxes of ammunition.

To ready the coilgun, you must make sure the supercapacitor has enough power by setting the recharge rate high enough (50% is usually enough), then insert full ammunition boxes into the coilgun loader.

The ammo boxes loaded in the coilguns seem empty. You need to unload them. Do this by dragging the empty boxes away from the loader. Drop the empty boxes on the ground by holding the green arrow above the ammo box when it's equipped.

Ammo boxes are large and unwieldy. You must use two hands to carry one and they can’t be carried around in the inventory. To drop an ammo box, either drag it away from your equip slot or press the unequip button on top of the equip slot.
infotexts.officer.hammerheadtext: To use the coilgun, interact ({0}) with the periscope. While on the periscope, aim with the mouse and fire by pressing {1}. To stop aiming, press {2}.\n\nThe gun uses a lot of power, so firing conservatively is key. Otherwise the supercapacitor may not be able to keep up.
infotexts.officer.rangedweapontext: Ranged weapons work the same way as melee weapons, except their accuracy is more dependent on the character’s weapons skill. Aim with {0} and fire with {1}.\n\nThey must also be loaded with ammunition. Hover the mouse cursor over a ranged weapon to see how many bullets, harpoons, etc. are contained. Drop ammunition into the slots or on the weapon itself to load the weapon.
infotexts.officer.mudraptortext: Mudraptors are bigger, meaner and more armored than crawlers. Taking them down requires more firepower. Aim for the mouth or belly and try to keep your distance.
infotexts.officer.armsubmarinetext: Find ammunition for the coilguns and load them. Recharge supercapacitors.\n\nIn most submarines, gun loaders and supercapacitors are located next to their respective gun controls. A value of 50% for supercapacitors’ recharge is usually enough to keep them ready for monster encounters. Set it to 100% when a lot of firing is expected.
infotexts.doctor.radio.knockeddown: That was a big one. Are you okay? Get yourself patched up, fast. We need a medic here stat.
infotexts.doctor.radio.assistantburns: They’ve got a nasty burn. You don’t have any bandages with you, do you? Get them to follow you while you go find some.
infotexts.doctor.radio.assistantburnshealed: I guess that’ll do. Make your way to the sub; it’s too dangerous to stay here.
infotexts.doctor.radio.enteredsub: Good. Everyone’s here. Check up on everybody while we get the vessel ready for transit.
infotexts.doctor.suppliestext:
Items are stored in containers of different sizes. You can see what’s inside one by interacting with it ({0}). Transfer items between character and container inventory by dragging or double-clicking.

When in a character’s inventory, items can be equipped by double-clicking on them or by pressing the corresponding quick-slot key.

To close the interface, press {1}.
infotexts.doctor.openmedicalinterfacetext: Press {0} or click your health bar to enter the medical interface.
infotexts.doctor.firstaidselftext: Afflictions affecting the character are shown in the list to the left, although some afflictions are local to specific limbs. You can inspect different limbs by clicking on them.\n\nTo treat an affliction, drag a medical item onto the highlighted area. Suggested items are shown in the interface, but caution must be exercised, since some characters’ medical skills aren’t high enough to suggest the correct treatment. In this case, you have some light internal damage. Morphine is effective in treating this affliction.
infotexts.doctor.medbayobjective: Take the crew member to the med bay
infotexts.doctor.medbaytext:
Sometimes you will encounter afflictions that you don’t have supplies to treat on the spot. In these situations it’s handy to get the patient to follow you to the med bay, where there are more supplies to treat them.

Find the character in question in the crew list to the left. Then find the “Follow” button and click on it. The character will now follow you until dismissed by clicking on the button again.

“Follow” command is only one of many commands you can give to other characters. Experiment with other commands during gameplay!
infotexts.doctor.treatburnstext: First aid can be administered to other characters, too. Treat them by highlighting the target character and pressing {0}. The interface will show their status on the left side of the screen.\n\nDrag the correct item into the medical interface to treat the affliction. Remember to select the correct limb before administering treatment. Bandages heal burns quickly. Find them in the highlighted cabinet.
infotexts.doctor.cprtext: When characters suffer too many injuries, they enter an unconscious state. In this state, their oxygen level falls constantly and when it gets to zero, they die. They can be resuscitated through CPR, which gets them to a stable state.\n\nResuscitate the patient by entering the medical interface ({0}) and clicking the green “resuscitate” button. The process may take a while.
infotexts.doctor.submarineobjective: Give medical assistance to everyone who needs it
infotexts.doctor.submarinetext:
The crew is ready to leave, but they are a bit banged up and someone is unconscious. Equipping the Health Scanner HUD will let you see who is injured and how.

Inspect each patient by pressing {0}, then administer the correct treatment. Remember to check each limb by selecting them in the medical interface.

Medical supplies are often found in the med bay or storage, along with some basic meds in the supply cabinets scattered throughout the sub. You can check each medical item’s description to see what they treat.
infotexts.captain.radio.complete: Glad you made it out of there. Welcome to [OUTPOSTNAME].
infotexts.captain.commandmedictext: Find the medic in the crew list to the left. Then find the “Follow” button in the command interface next to the portraits and click on it. The character will now follow you until dismissed by clicking on the button again.
infotexts.captain.commandmechanicobjective: Order the mechanic to perform maintenance
infotexts.captain.commandmechanictext: To order repairs, click on the “Repair Damaged Systems” button in the list next to the mechanic’s portrait. The character will then patrol and search for any mechanical items in need of repairing.
infotexts.captain.commandsecurityobjective: Order the security to man guns
infotexts.captain.commandsecuritytext: To order somebody to man guns, click on the “Operate Weapons” button in the list next to the character’s portrait. Then choose the weapon you want them to operate.
infotexts.captain.commandengineerobjective: Order the engineer to power up the reactor
infotexts.captain.commandengineertext: To order somebody to operate the reactor, click on the command interface and choose “Operate Reactor”, then “Power up”. The character will then tend to the reactor.
infotexts.captain.undocktext: To get moving, you need to undock the submarine from the outpost. Do this by going into the navigation console and pressing the “Toggle docking” button.
infotexts.captain.navigatetext:
Plot a course for the submarine by clicking on the sonar display. The navigation terminal will adjust the ballast and engine’s force accordingly and automatically.

To see where the sub is heading, turn on active sonar. Do that by finding the sonar settings next to the display and setting it from “passive” to “active”.

Move carefully. The faster the submarine moves, the more difficult it will be to slow it down. Colliding with cave walls will damage the hull and cause leaks. For tutorial purposes, this sub will be protected against hull breaches.
infotexts.captain.docktext:
To dock the submarine, maneuver the ship’s and outpost’s docking ports close to each other and toggle the docking clamps. Ports are displayed in green on the sonar display.

When the ports are close to each other, a line will be shown on the sonar display—use that to your advantage. When the line is fully green, close the clamps by pressing “toggle docking”. The submarine will then be locked into position, and the docking hatch will be open for as long as the docking clamps are engaged.

When positioning the submarine for docking, radical movements can easily cause you to overshoot your target. Move slowly and carefully to avoid colliding with the outpost. Using autopilot and “maintain position” is helpful in setting the position you want the submarine to move to.
infotexts.karmaexplanation: Karma reflects the helpful and harmful actions you've taken while playing. Actions such as repairing the submarine, operating devices and killing monsters increase Karma, while actions such as attacking members of your crew or damaging the submarine decrease it. If your Karma drops too low, you may not get assigned to certain jobs anymore, or, in more extreme cases, you may be banned from the server.
infotexts.karmabanwarning: Warning: You will be banned from the server if your Karma decreases below [banthreshold].
infotexts.karmabanned: You have been banned from the server because your Karma decreased below [banthreshold].
infotexts.karmajobdisallowed: You are not allowed to select this job because your Karma is too low ([yourkarma]/[minkarma]).
infotexts.campaigndisclaimertext:
Please note that Barotrauma is still in Early Access, and that many aspects of the game are incomplete and still being worked on.

The Campaign Mode is still lacking many of the features we've planned for the full version, and is not yet as enjoyable as the multiplayer. In the current version, playing the game solo can also be more challenging to new players than playing it with other people—even though the AI crew can give you a hand with some tasks, they are usually not as useful as real human players. If you're interested in what's to come in future updates, click the Campaign Roadmap button below.

We do, however, recommend that you at least play the single-player tutorial before diving into the multiplayer. Good luck, sailor!
infotexts.campaignroadmaptext:
- Explorable locations: As of now, the locations on the campaign map are essentially just menus where you can buy supplies and hire new crew members, but during the Early Access period they will become actual physical locations you can enter and explore.

- Expanded story: You will be able to learn more about the world of Barotrauma by interacting with NPCs and by exploring the outposts and non-man-made locations.

- New mission types: We have plans for several completely new mission types, including personnel transport missions and salvage missions into shipwrecks.

- Balancing: Currently the campaign economy is not very well balanced, but we will start to put more focus into it when we have more of the content in.

- End goal: At the moment it’s not possible to complete the campaign, but in future versions the mysterious location at the center of the map will become reachable...
infotexts.editordisclaimertext: The submarine and character editors are modding tools that can be used to expand the core game by creating your own submarines and monsters. The custom creations can be shared in the Steam Workshop.\n\nAt the moment the editors are only available in English. The process of building a fully playable submarine or a functional monster can be quite involved, and unfortunately we don’t offer in-game tutorials or documentation for the editors yet. If you want to take a shot at creating your own custom content with the editors, you may be able to find help through the following links:
infotexts.entitydescription.hull: Hulls determine which parts are considered to be 'inside the sub'. Generally every room should be enclosed by a hull.
infotexts.entitydescription.gap: Gaps allow water and air to flow between two hulls.
